text: is a ward of Kitakyūshū, Fukuoka, Japan. It is the smallest ward of Kitakyūshū city. The ward is only 16.66 km2 big. In 2000, the population of the ward was 64,330. ==History and Geography== In 1899, the Tobata-cho (Tobata town) was created. The city was merged into Kitakyushu in 1963. It officially became part of the ward on April 1, 1963. == Other websites== * Tobata Gion festival * KIT Tobata campus * 100 Photos of Tobata * Tobata ward office (official page) * Kitakyushu Municipal Museum of Art * Kitakyushu Techno Center * Wel Tobata Category:Wards of Kitakyūshū Category:1963 establishments in Japan
title: Tobata-ku, Kitakyūshū
